name: Lobby 7
description: Lobby 7, the main entrance lobby to the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, is the gateway through which many MIT buildings can be accessed.

name: Lobby 10
description: Memorial Lobby (10), a War Memorial is frequently used by students and affiliates to promote student group and department activities.

name: Alchemist
description: This is an art installation made by Jaume Plensa in 2010. The piece was designed to emphasize 'thinking and calculation'. It sits near the Stratton Student Center and is across the street from Lobby 7.

name: Northwest Passage
description: Northwest Passage is an installation made by Olafur Eliasson in 2018. The passage consists of ringed lights that guide one into the newly built MIT.nano building.

name: Green Building
description: The Green Building (which isn't actually green!) is really shorthand for the Cecil and Ida Green Building. It's an academic building which concluded construction in 1964 and is home to MIT's Department of Earth, Atmospheric, and Planetary Sciences (EAPS). It also happens to be one of Cambridge's tallest buildings.

name: Fairchild Building
description: The Fairchild Building, also known by its number as Building 38, is home to many segments of the EECS department at MIT. The 6.08 Lab is also inside of it!

name: Next House
description: Next House, officially called 500 Memorial Drive, is home to 360 friendly undergraduate residents.

name: New House
description: New House, also called New West Campus Houses, is home to around 290 undergraduates.

name: MacGregor House
description: MacGregor House was built in 1970 and is home to 300 undergraduate residents.

name: Burton-Conner House
description: Burton-Conner House, while currently closed due to renovations, usually houses around 340 undergraduates.

name: Baker House
description: Baker House, named after Everett Moore Baker, a former MIT Dean of Students who died in a plane crash, houses around 315 students.

name: McCormick House
description: McCormick Hall is MIT's only women-only dorm and houses 237 undergraduates. It is named after Katharine Dexter McCormick (SB 1904, Biology): biologist, suffragist, philanthropist.

name: Maseeh Hall
description: Maseeh Hall is named after Fariborz Maseeh and was opened as a dorm in 2010, though it existed as a Hotel between 1901-1937.

name: Simmons Hall
description: Simmons Hall, affectionately called the Sponge, was designed by Steven Hall and opened in 2002.

name: New Vassar
description: New Vassar, MIT's newest dorm opened in late 2020 and houses 450 undergraduates.

name: Barker Engineering Library
description: Barker Engineering Library is located on the 5th-8th floors of Lobby 10, allowing students to study underneath the iconic Great Dome.

name: MIT Hayden Library
description: Newly renovated, MIT's Hayden Library boasts a Courtyard Cafe, 24/7 study spaces, and views of the Charles River.

name: East Campus
description: Built in 1924, East Campus is MIT's second-oldest undergraduate dorm,home to over 350 undergraduates.

name: Ray and Maria Stata Center
description: Home to many of MIT's course 6 buildings, Ray and Maria Stata Center was designed by 'Pritzzker Prize-winning architect Frank Gehry.'

name: MIT Chapel
description: MIT's Chapel, located at a central spot on campus has been the host of several weddings to MIT's students and alums.

name: Tang Hall
description: Tang Hall is a high rise graduate dorm behind Next House that houses about 400 students and families.

name: Westgate Apartments
description: Westgate Apartments is near Tang Hall houses both MIT undergraduate and graduate students and families.

name: MIT.nano
description: Also known as Building 12, MIT.nano will soon be renamed 'in honor of Lisa T. Su ('90, SM '91, PHD '94).

name: Zesiger Sports and Fitness Center
description: The Z Center is the central athletic facility on campus and is frequently used by MIT students and affiliates alike.

name: Stratton Student Center
description: Affectionately called 'The Stud,' the Stratton Student Center contains study spaces, Music Rooms, Convenience Stores, Restaurants, and more for MIT students.

name: Random Hall
description: Random Hall is the smallest undergraduate dorm, housing 93 undergraduates.
